newsitem.title: EGYPT: Pachin share offer subscribed 2.15 times.
newsitem.headline: Pachin share offer subscribed 2.15 times.

text.p: An offer of more than 1.3 million shares in the state-dominated company Pachin/Paints and Chemical Industries was subscribed more than twice over, a spokesman for the agents said on Monday.
"It was covered about 2.15 times," said a spokesman at Commercial International Investment Company (CIIC).

The state's Holding Company for Chemical Industries, which owns 87.5 percent of the 10 million shares in Pachin, had offered 1.3125 million shares by auction at a minimum price of 137.99 pounds a share. The deadline for bids was December 25.
The CIIC spokesman said he could give no more details of the Pachin auction at least until Tuesday.
He also said he expected strong demand for shares in Cairo Precision Industries, which is raising capital by 25 million pounds ($7.4 million) by selling new shares to the public.
The company will start accepting applications for 60 days from January 5 but the offer could close at the end of the statutory minimum period of 10 days.
An announcement in Egyptian newspapers had erroneously said that the offer would open on December 24.

"It is expected to be 10 to 15 times oversubscribed," the CIIC spokesman said. Cairo Precision Industries is one of the few established Egyptian private companies to open up through a share issue to the public.
